cruel.name: Cruel
cruel.effect: Deal ongoing damage equals 5 times your level. As usual, a normal save (11+) ends the damage. A critical hit doesn’t double this ongoing damage.
cruel.championFeat: Once per day, you can instead use cruel to deal 5 ongoing damage per level against an enemy you miss or that you roll a natural odd attack against.

breathweapon.name: Cruel
breathweapon.effect: Make a close-quarters breath weapon attack as a quick action using your highest ability score against one nearby enemy’s Physical Defense. On a hit, the attack deals 1d6 damage per your level of an energy type that makes sense for your character.
breathweapon.championFeat: Your breath weapon attack targets 1d3 nearby enemies in a group instead.

bestshot.name: That’s Your Best Shot?
bestshot.effect: Once per battle as a free action after you have been hit, you can heal using a recovery. If the escalation die is less than 2, you only get half the usual healing from the recovery. Unlike other recoveries that might allow you to take an average result, you have to roll this one!. Note that you can’t use this ability if the attack drops you to 0 hp or below. You’ve got to be on your feet to sneer at their attack and recover.
bestshot.championFeat: If the escalation die is 2+ when you use that’s your best shot, the recovery is free.

neversaydie.name: Never Say Die!
neversaydie.trigger: You are at 0 HP or below.
neversaydie.effect: Roll a normal save if you have a recovery available. On an 11+, instead of falling unconscious,  you stay  on  your  feet  and can heal using a recovery. Add the recovery hit points to 0 HP to determine your hp total.
neversaydie.championFeat: If you roll a 16+ on your never-say-die save, you gain an additional standard action during your next turn.

confounding.name: Confounding
confounding.trigger: Roll a natural 16+ with an attack
confounding.effect: Once per battle, you can also daze the target until the end of your next turn.
confounding.championFeat: Instead of being dazed, the target of your confounding ability is weakened until the end of your next turn.

surprising.name: Surprising
surprising.effect: Once per battle, subtract one from the natural result of one of your own d20 rolls.
surprising.championFeat: You gain an additional use of surprising each battle, but you can only use it to affect a nearby ally’s d20 roll

lethal.name: Lethal
lethal.effect: Once per battle, reroll a melee attack and use the roll you prefer as the result.
lethal.championFeat: If the lethal attack reroll is a natural 16+, you can use lethal again later this battle.

evasive.name: Evasive
evasive.effect: Once per battle, force an enemy to reroll the attack with a –2 penalty..
evasive.championFeat: The enemy’s reroll takes a –5 penalty instead.

highbloodTeleport.name: Highblood Teleport
highbloodTeleport.effect: Once per battle as a move action, place yourself in a nearby location you can see.
highbloodTeleport.championFeat: Deal damage equal to twice your level to one enemy engaged with you before or after you teleport.

halo.name: Halo
halo.effect: Once per battle during your turn, gain a +2 bonus to all defenses until you are hit by an attack (or until the battle ends).
halo.championFeat: Halo also activates automatically any time you heal using a recovery.

quickToFight.name: Quick to Fight
quickToFight.trigger: At the start of each battle
quickToFight.effect: Roll initiative twice and choose the result you want.
quickToFight.championFeat: If you roll a natural 19 or 20 for initiative, increase the escalation die by 1 (usually from 0 to 1 since it’s the start of the battle).

curseOfChaos.name: Curse of Chaos
curseOfChaos.trigger: Nearby enemy rolls a natural 1–5 on an attack or a save
curseOfChaos.effect: Once per battle as a free action, turn their roll into a natural 1 and improvise a further curse that shows how their attempt backfires horribly. A curse should have about the same impact as a typical once-per-battle ability. For example, a typical curse might lead to the cursed attacker dealing half damage to themself with their fumbled attack and being dazed until the end of their next turn. The GM may reward storytelling flair and/or limit the suggested effects of the curse.
curseOfChaos.championFeat: Whenever a nearby enemy rolls a natural 1 on an attack against you, you can use curse of chaos against them without expending it.

elvenGrace.name: Elven Grace
elvenGrace.trigger: At the start of each of your turns
elvenGrace.effect: Roll a die to see if you get an extra standard action. If your roll is equal to or lower than the escalation die, you get an extra standard action that turn. At the start of battle, you roll a d6. Each time you successfully gain an extra action, the size of the die you roll increases by one step on the following progression: (d4), d6, d8, d10, d12, d20. If you get an extra action after rolling a d20, you can’t get any more extra actions that battle.
elvenGrace.championFeat: Once per day, start a battle rolling a d4 for elven grace instead of a d6.
